newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Shares in Royal Dutch jump on 1996 results.
newsitem.headline: Shares in Royal Dutch jump on 1996 results.

text.p: Shares in Royal Dutch on Thursday surged after the company posted 1996 results generally interpreted as strong.
The company announced a 4-for-1 share split for Royal Dutch shares and a 2-for-1 share split for Shell shares.
Royal Dutch shares rallied on the news, prolonging yesterday's and this morning's surge.
The stock reached a high of 354.60 guilders, but then gave up part of the gain, hovering around 349.70 guilders at 1050 GMT, up 13.90 guilders from Wednesday's close.
On Wednesday, the share gained 5.80 guilders.

"The figures were nicely above expectations, but the share split was also extremely positive. The company had already indicated it would consider a split at a share price level above 300 guilders, but a 4-for-1 split was not really foreseen," one dealer said.

He added that, although the volume traded was relatively heavy, with Royal Dutch second on the list of most traded shares -behind Philips which also released 1996 figures this morning-, it was not massive given the major price reaction.
